headline: Investors Expect the Market to Keep Rallying This Year
summary: 3.7% That's how much Bank of America expects the S&P 500 to increase in 2026. JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs expect the index to rise more. Should the S&P 500 climb for a fourth consecutive year, it would be the longest such streak since 2007.

headline: The Dow Hits a Record Close
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average got its first all-time high of 2026—but fell just short of closing above 49000 for the first time.  The index was up as much as 1.7% in midday trading, then faded a bit to end the day at 48977.18, up 1.2%.  The move to a new closing high came in part thanks to a jump in shares of Chevron, the sole remaining U.S. oil major in Venezuela.

raw.headline: The Dow Hits a Record Close
raw.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average got its first all-time high of 2026—but fell just short of closing above 49000 for the first time.  The index was up as much as 1.7% in midday trading, then faded a bit to end the day at 48977.18, up 1.2%.  The move to a new closing high came in part thanks to a jump in shares of Chevron, the sole remaining U.S. oil major in Venezuela.

headline: How The Subsea 7 (OB:SUBC) Story Is Shifting With New Targets And Contract Wins
summary: Subsea 7’s fair value estimate has been revised to NOK 228.39, while the Street target has been adjusted to NOK 208, leaving a modest gap that both bullish and cautious voices are now debating. Supportive analysts see this as a fine tuning of expectations and a sign that the long term story remains intact, while more conservative views treat the lower target as a reminder that execution on revenue still needs to be proven. As these signals continue to shift, it is worth keeping an eye on how...

headline: How JPMorganChase plans to jolt 'on-chain' finance
summary: The bank's Kinexys blockchain unit processes a fraction of the institution's overall payment volume. It's betting that an appetite for the technology's promise of speedy processing and liquidity will make that larger.

headline: Financial Stocks Poised for Record as JPMorgan Nears Milestone Closing Price
summary: The S&P 500’s financials sector was on track for a record closing high on Monday as investors appeared to find more opportunities than risk in the wake of the Trump administration’s intervention in Venezuela.  JPMorgan Chase, the largest U.S. lender by assets and the second-largest component of the financials sector index after Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway, jumped 3.3%.  Jamie Dimon’s JPMorgan was on pace to close above a market cap of $900 billion for the first time on record, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

raw.headline: Financial Stocks Poised for Record as JPMorgan Nears Milestone Closing Price
raw.summary: The S&P 500’s financials sector was on track for a record closing high on Monday as investors appeared to find more opportunities than risk in the wake of the Trump administration’s intervention in Venezuela.  JPMorgan Chase, the largest U.S. lender by assets and the second-largest component of the financials sector index after Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway, jumped 3.3%.  Jamie Dimon’s JPMorgan was on pace to close above a market cap of $900 billion for the first time on record, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: CNBC Daily Open: Investors had much to cheer in 2025 — but 2026's starting out rocky
summary: The S&P 500 rallied 16.39% in 2025, mostly on the back of enthusiasm over AI. But investors have to contend with the U.S.' attack on Venezuela.
